content:
• Wednesday, December 14, 2011
  • LRCX

    Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) agrees to acquire Novellus Systems (NASDAQ:NVLS-OLD) in an all-stock...

    Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) agrees to acquire Novellus Systems (NASDAQ:NVLS-OLD) in an all-stock transaction valued at $3.3B. NVLS shareholders will receive 1.125 shares of LRCX for each of their shares, valuing NVLS at $44.42/share, or ~12.5% above its closing price today. Lam also announces a $1.6M common stock repurchase program. NVLS +10.2% before trading halted, LRCX -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • CVX

    Chevron (NYSE:CVX) says it hasn’t received any formal notice of a Brazilian lawsuit...

    Chevron (NYSE:CVX) says it hasn’t received any formal notice of a Brazilian lawsuit against the oil giant and Transocean (NYSE:RIG) seeking $10.7B in damages from an oil spill last month. "From the outset, Chevron responded responsibly to the incident at its Frade Field and has dealt transparently with all Brazilian authorities," the company says. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • NDSN

    Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN) drops 5.7% AH after posting FQ4 results. Revenue of $331M (+14% Y/Y) beat...

    Nordson (NASDAQ:NDSN) drops 5.7% AH after posting FQ4 results. Revenue of $331M (+14% Y/Y) beat by $10.5M, and EPS of $0.81 was in-line. However, the company is guiding for FQ1 revenue of $270M-$281M and EPS of $0.54-$0.61, below a consensus of $288.9M and $0.68. Nordson and other industrial equipment makers are often seen as bellwethers for broader manufacturing-related activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • ANIP

    More on BioSante (BPAX): Shares are now down 76.1% in AH trading, following the company's...

    More on BioSante (BPAX): Shares are now down 76.1% in AH trading, following the company's disclosure of negative trial results for its LibiGel drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • AET

    Aetna (NYSE:AET) gains 1% AH after using an 8-K to lift its 2011 EPS guidance to $5.15 from $5,...

    Aetna (NYSE:AET) gains 1% AH after using an 8-K to lift its 2011 EPS guidance to $5.15 from $5, and its 2012 EPS guidance to $5 from $4.80. The company also says it will have 18.4M members enrolled in medical plans at year's end, but that this figure will decline to 17.9M by the end of Q1 2012. Aetna is hosting its annual investor conference tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • ANIP

    BioSante (BPAX -15.5%) plunged in late trading, and a PR issued after the bell provides the...

    BioSante (BPAX -15.5%) plunged in late trading, and a PR issued after the bell provides the likely reason. The company says its LibiGel drug failed to achieve its primary endpoints during Phase III trials. The company says it will continue to analyze trial data, so as to determine its next step.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • FSLR

    Analysts say First Solar (FSLR -21.6%) probably still hasn’t owned up to how bad things...

    Analysts say First Solar (FSLR -21.6%) probably still hasn’t owned up to how bad things can get, even after the solar bellwether's massive guidance cut. Wunderlich, in lowering its price target on shares to $38 from $55, says FSLR has "few levers to lower costs and stay competitive, but it doesn’t extricate the company from chasing falling prices... it is chasing a rabbit down the hole."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • SHPG

    Shares of ViroPharma (VPHM +15%) skyrocket after the biotech company announces approval of new...

    Shares of ViroPharma (VPHM +15%) skyrocket after the biotech company announces approval of new labeling for its Vancocin capsules made effective through FDA approval of its supplemental new drug application. As a result, VPHM believes Vancocin will enjoy three years of exclusivity, and that generic vancomycin capsules will not be approved during this period.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • PETS

    BofA initiates coverage on PetMed Express (PETS -4.3%) at Underperform, saying the retailer of...

    BofA initiates coverage on PetMed Express (PETS -4.3%) at Underperform, saying the retailer of prescription animal medications and other pet supplies enjoyas a competitive advantage in the niche pet prescription market, but increased competition for its over-the-counter medication calls its future growth rate into question.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • ROYL

    Shares of Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL -11%) fall off after the firm files a $100M mixed shelf...

    Shares of Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL -11%) fall off after the firm files a $100M mixed shelf offering (S-3) to sell combinations of stock, convertibles, and debt securities.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • SJM

    Folgers owner J.M Smucker (SJM +0.6%) trades higher as Bloomberg notes dire predictions of a...

    Folgers owner J.M Smucker (SJM +0.6%) trades higher as Bloomberg notes dire predictions of a 2012 glut for robusta coffee beans. Macquarie predicts robusta prices will fall 9% in 2012, on top of an 8% decline this year, thanks to a combo of weak macro conditions and rising production. However, prices for the arabica beans that Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) relies upon are expected to remain strong. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • RIG

    Reports are filtering in (I, II) that both Transocean (RIG -4.9%) and Chevron (CVX -3.3%) have...

    Reports are filtering in (I, II) that both Transocean (RIG -4.9%) and Chevron (CVX -3.3%) have been asked to suspend operations in Brazil by prosecutors. The move could be a major blow for each, with tapping the lush oil fields located off Brazil's shore part of both firm's strategic plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • LRN

    K12 (LRN -1.6%) responds to yesterday's New York Times article criticizing the company, saying...

    K12 (LRN -1.6%) responds to yesterday's New York Times article criticizing the company, saying it's unfair and one-sided. Instead of presenting a factually accurate view, the writer editorializes, selectively picking and choosing facts to satisfy a pre-determined narrative. The company points out that the article "omitted important information on the structure of online schools, student performance, teacher training and professional development, and the full scope of education programs and services provided by K12."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • GLD

    Gold prices (GLD -3.5%) are supposedly tied to inflation, but Eddy Elfenbein believes gold's...

    Gold prices (GLD -3.5%) are supposedly tied to inflation, but Eddy Elfenbein believes gold's value should be based on interest rates. He finds gold acts like a leveraged short position on short-term real rates, with a break-even point at 2%. David Merkel's variation on the model projects gold reaching $3,000 in mid-2013 if the Fed stays true to its word to keep rates low.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • CVX

    Bloomberg's Dominic Chu reports that Brazil prosecutors asked Chevron (CVX -3.1%) to pay $10.7B...

    Bloomberg's Dominic Chu reports that Brazil prosecutors asked Chevron (CVX -3.1%) to pay $10.7B in damages related to the offshore oil spill. Shares spiked down 2% on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • RHI

    Robert Half (RHI -2.5%) trades lower on a SunTrust downgrade to Neutral on valuation, citing...

    Robert Half (RHI -2.5%) trades lower on a SunTrust downgrade to Neutral on valuation, citing slowing European demand and aggressive recruiting competition.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • KSS

    Kohl's (KSS -1.5%) dips after Deutsche cuts the shares to Hold, saying the company appears to...

    Kohl's (KSS -1.5%) dips after Deutsche cuts the shares to Hold, saying the company appears to have inadvertently trained customers to shop only on promotions, which has led to much greater comp volatility. Additionally, increased competition from Macy's and discounters like TJ Maxx has whittled down its traditional "value gap."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • HEI

    Aircraft component maker Heico (HEI +1.3%) outperforms after obtaining a $670M unsecured credit...

    Aircraft component maker Heico (HEI +1.3%) outperforms after obtaining a $670M unsecured credit facility, good through Dec. 2016. The facility replaces one worth $300M, and will feature interest rates of 75-225 bps above LIBOR.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • TLAB

    Tellabs (TLAB -2.7%) says its CFO Timothy Wiggins is resigning at the end of the month to take...

    Tellabs (TLAB -2.7%) says its CFO Timothy Wiggins is resigning at the end of the month to take the finance chief post at for-profit educator DeVry. The company names Tom Minichiello, its CAO, as interim chief executive, pending plans to conduct a search for a suitable replacement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • LTM

    Shares of Brazilian airline Tam SA (TAM +2.3%) and Chile's Lan SA (LFL +2%) gain as Brazil's...

    Shares of Brazilian airline Tam SA (TAM +2.3%) and Chile's Lan SA (LFL +2%) gain as Brazil's antitrust regulators begin their review of the proposed merger, and are expected to issue their ruling by the end of the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC +6%), which had 14.8% of its float shorted as of Nov. 30, is up on a down...

    InterDigital (IDCC +6%), which had 14.8% of its float shorted as of Nov. 30, is up on a down day, thanks to renewed speculation about Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) being interested in buying the 3G/4G patent holder (in spite of its pending acquisition of MMI). Nonetheless, InterDigital shares remain off sharply from their summer highs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCK

    Crown Holdings (CCK +3.3%) posts a gain on word the company will buy back shares from Barclays...

    Crown Holdings (CCK +3.3%) posts a gain on word the company will buy back shares from Barclays Bank under an accelerated repurchasement program.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • VRTX

    Shares of Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +6.3%) perk up after Credit Suisse upgrades the firm to...

    Shares of Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +6.3%) perk up after Credit Suisse upgrades the firm to Outperform all the way from Underperform. Analysts with the firm point to VRTX's 40% drop in share price since summer, calling it a "buying opportunity" ahead of 2012 pipeline catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • TOL

    Toll Brothers (TOL -2.3%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Sell on valuation, saying...

    Toll Brothers (TOL -2.3%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Sell on valuation, saying the seasonal pattern of buying homebuilders ahead of a potential turn in the spring has run its course, with limited potential for further gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • DHR

    Danaher Corporation (DHR +1%) gains after reaffirming its Q4 EPS guidance of $0.75 - $0.80, and...

    Danaher Corporation (DHR +1%) gains after reaffirming its Q4 EPS guidance of $0.75 - $0.80, and saying it sees its FY12 EPS in the range of $3.20 - $3.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • PCG

    Investors appear to be encouraged by PG&E's (PCG +0.6%) acknowledgement of its liability in...

    Investors appear to be encouraged by PG&E's (PCG +0.6%) acknowledgement of its liability in the 2010 San Bruno gas pipeline explosion, after earlier statements by the company's attorneys suggested the victims' conduct may have contributed to their injuries.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +0.2%) says it's submitted a New Drug Application to the FDA for its...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +0.2%) says it's submitted a New Drug Application to the FDA for its HIV-induced diarrhea drug Crofelemer. The agency has 60 days to review the application and decide whether it will enter its review process. The drug developer is also researching alternative possible uses for the drug, including the treatment of irritable bowel syndrome.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • TEF

    Spanish telecom giant Telefonica (TEF -2.7%) slashes its planned dividend for 2012 to...

    Spanish telecom giant Telefonica (TEF -2.7%) slashes its planned dividend for 2012 to €1.3/share from this year's €1.6/share, as "economic and operating environment and financial markets conditions have changed materially." This brings the company's dividend yield down to about 10%, based on today's price. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • DFS

    Discover Financial (DFS +0.4%) clings to positive territory after Credit Suisse ups estimates...

    Discover Financial (DFS +0.4%) clings to positive territory after Credit Suisse ups estimates ahead of its Q4 due to lower charge-off rates. In September and October the company's trust net loss rate improved 34 bps to 3.26%. To reflect the improvement, the firm raises Q4 EPS estimates to $1.00 from $0.84, and FY11 EPS estimates to $4.10 from $3.95. Separately, CLSA recommends owning Discover going into tomorrows earnings, saying the company will beat expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • PGR

    Pushing higher despite a weakening stock market is Progressive (PGR +3.4%), which reports...

    Pushing higher despite a weakening stock market is Progressive (PGR +3.4%), which reports November net income of $0.20/share vs $0.17/share a year ago, with net premiums written during the month rising 6% Y/Y to $1.07B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • END

    Oil and gas explorer Endeavour (END +1%) says it's terminated its agreement to purchase...

    Oil and gas explorer Endeavour (END +1%) says it's terminated its agreement to purchase Marcellus shale assets from SM Energy (SM -5.5%). The company didn't provide any reason for cancelling the sale, but last month it reported steep Q3 losses, and its CEO noted at the time that the company planned to conserve capital for near-term projects until it sees better North American natural-gas prices and production begins at its wells in the Bacchus field.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • ANIP

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX +2.1%) gets a lift after it cancels its appearance from an...

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX +2.1%) gets a lift after it cancels its appearance from an Oppenheimer conference - fueling speculation that data on testosterone-boosting Libigel's efficacy is due to be released shortly.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • GE

    GE (GE +0.2%) fends off a weak tape after Credit Suisse raises estimates, saying the company's...

    GE (GE +0.2%) fends off a weak tape after Credit Suisse raises estimates, saying the company's margins may be down but energy profits should return to growth in Q4. The firm ups its overall EPS estimates to $1.36 for 2011, $1.50 for 2012 and $1.71 for 2013. Separately, Sterne Agee says the positive impact from the company's recent restructuring leaves the stock poised for a rebound.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM

  • Precious metals accelerate their slide alongside the drop in equity markets and the euro. Gold...

    Precious metals accelerate their slide alongside the drop in equity markets and the euro. Gold is down 4.5% to $1,589/oz., the lowest price since September. Silver, off 8%, drops below $29/oz. On the industrial side, copper -4.8% to $3.27/lb., still well above the $3 level hit in October.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 10 Comments
  • CBK

    Christopher & Banks (CBK -3.2%) says it expects a loss for Q3, as aggressive sales markdowns...

    Christopher & Banks (CBK -3.2%) says it expects a loss for Q3, as aggressive sales markdowns to move seasonal inventory negatively impacted margins, leaving comparable store sales essentially flat for the quarter. The company also suspends its dividend due to the weak performance and plans to close about 100 stores. Separately, the company appoints Joel Waller as president for a one-year term.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • FRP

    Shares of FairPoint Communications (NASDAQ:FRP)  tripped up circuit breakers on the way to...

    Shares of FairPoint Communications (NASDAQ:FRP)  tripped up circuit breakers on the way to a 10.5% gain. Traders are scratching their heads about what all the fuss is about - reporting anecdotally seeing flukey bid and ask prices on shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -7.6%) has given back all of yesterday's gains, as investors show their dismay...

    Groupon (GRPN -7.6%) has given back all of yesterday's gains, as investors show their dismay over 6 out of 11 IPO underwriters taking up neutral stances, often while citing valuation concerns. However, BofA and Barclays can be counted among the bulls: the former thinks Groupon will deliver healthy Q/Q growth in Q4, while the latter believes Groupon has "cracked the code" for using the web to drive local commerce.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • NUS

    Nu Skin (NUS -1.9%) acquires LifeGen Technologies, a genomics company based in Madison,...

    Nu Skin (NUS -1.9%) acquires LifeGen Technologies, a genomics company based in Madison, Wisconsin for $11.7M. The purchase expands Nu Skin's anti-aging research capabilities, giving it access to LifeGen's extensive proprietary tissue bank and gene expression database, plus patents and other intellectual property related to the field.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • TCF

    TCF Financial (TCB -2.3%) after JP Morgan resumes coverage of the shares with a downgrade to...

    TCF Financial (TCB -2.3%) after JP Morgan resumes coverage of the shares with a downgrade to Neutral, saying it expects the company's results to be negatively impacted over the near-term due to fee pressures and lower interest income.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -3.3%) reaffirms its 2011 outlook for $58B in revenue and maintains its current...

    Caterpillar (CAT -3.3%) reaffirms its 2011 outlook for $58B in revenue and maintains its current quarterly dividend rate of $0.46/share for shareholders. The company says its 2012 outlook will be released soon, and will include a full-year of Bucyrus-related sales of about $5B. Shares may be taking a dip today because of Joy Global's gloomy warning on near-term production.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • OLED

    Shares of Universal Display (PANL -8.5%) are down again after Piper Jaffray says expectations...

    Shares of Universal Display (PANL -8.5%) are down again after Piper Jaffray says expectations for next year's revenue could be too high. Projected $44M in licensing revenue from Samsung to use PANL's OLED technology in displays might come in 30%-50% lower, Piper says, and Apple's use of OLED displays in its gadgets is not assured.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • DHI

    Homebuilder D.R. Horton (DHI -1.2%) is lower this morning after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares...

    Homebuilder D.R. Horton (DHI -1.2%) is lower this morning after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Hold on valuation, saying the group is trading near multi-year highs and recovery valuations are overdone.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -10.1%) take a double-digit beatdown after data...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -10.1%) take a double-digit beatdown after data from SymphonyIRI Group shows it lost 0.4 percentage points of coffee market share by dollars, slipping to 8.4%. Adding to the negative sentiment, Dougherty analyst Greg McKinley notes data from another research group shows an alarming widening spread between GMCR brewer shipments and consumer purchases of coffee machines in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -2.8%) shares slide after a report by Disclosure Insight, which includes a brief...

    Netflix (NFLX -2.8%) shares slide after a report by Disclosure Insight, which includes a brief item that is apparently a reprint from Dec. 5, discussing whether Netflix is the subject of an undisclosed SEC investigation.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • SGI

    Silicon Graphics (SGI -12%) gets hit after announcing its CEO and president, Mark Barrenechea,...

    Silicon Graphics (SGI -12%) gets hit after announcing its CEO and president, Mark Barrenechea, has resigned effective January, 2012. The company names board chairman Ronald Verdoorn as interim CEO while a search is conducted for a permanent replacement.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • JOY

    Shares of Joy Global (JOY -7.5%) extend their premarket losses after its FQ4 report included a...

    Shares of Joy Global (JOY -7.5%) extend their premarket losses after its FQ4 report included a warning on near term production. After sizing up the earnings report, JPMorgan maintains a Neutral rating on the firm, noting that the firm sees strong industry fundamentals despite its projected sluggish growth around the corner.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM

  • Crude oil futures fall near $97/barrel after OPEC officially announces that its members will...

    Crude oil futures fall near $97/barrel after OPEC officially announces that its members will maintain current production of 30M bpd, including output from Libya. The cartel noted that although world oil demand is forecast to increase slightly in 2012, the rise is expected to be partially offset by a projected increase in non-OPEC supply. Nymex crude -2.9% to $97.26. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • GEVA

    Synageva BioPharma (GEVA +5.1%) gets a kickstart with a timely initiation from Wedbush to...

    Synageva BioPharma (GEVA +5.1%) gets a kickstart with a timely initiation from Wedbush to Outperform with a price target of $32. Analysts see Phase I/II releases in 2012 building on positive results with the firm's treatment for Wolman disease. Shares of GEVA hit a 52-week high off the momentum.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • DAL

    Airline stocks soar after Delta (DAL +2.7%) says it expects to earn a larger-than-expected 2011...

    Airline stocks soar after Delta (DAL +2.7%) says it expects to earn a larger-than-expected 2011 adjusted profit of $1.1B, vs. $977M consensus. Delta forecasts "solid" earnings growth for 2012 and continued free cash flow generation with the help of additional seat capacity cuts and greater corporate travel demand. LCC +4.2%, UAL +1.8%, LUV +1.8%, JBLU +2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • AVP

    Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) bursts 10% higher at the open after yesterday's announcement that it...

    Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) bursts 10% higher at the open after yesterday's announcement that it would search for a new chief executive to replace Andrea Jung. Citigroup hails the move and thinks the beauty products firm can perform better, but “there is no easy fix," and change takes time. So far today, Caris and BMO Capital have upgraded the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM

  • Precious metals are down sharply again this morning, led by silver, off 6.9% to $29.10, and...

    Precious metals are down sharply again this morning, led by silver, off 6.9% to $29.10, and within sight of its yearly low set in January of about $27/oz. Off 2.9% to $1,614, gold is at a 2 month low. Chatter abounds of hedge fund (Paulson) liquidations and central bank shenanigans, but gold has had a nice decade run - can't it just sell off once in awhile?

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 4 Comments
  • ACOM

    Morgan Stanley rains on Ancestry.com's (ACOM -3.7%) parade with a downgrade to Equal Weight from...

    Morgan Stanley rains on Ancestry.com's (ACOM -3.7%) parade with a downgrade to Equal Weight from Overweight. Analysts with the firm caution sales of the online family history provider could slow in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • AABA

    Goldman pulls no punches in a bearish report on Yahoo (YHOO), arguing its deteriorating core...

    Goldman pulls no punches in a bearish report on Yahoo (YHOO), arguing its deteriorating core business outweighs any value that can be unlocked by asset sales. The firm notes Yahoo's global minutes/user are down 5% Y/Y, contrasting starkly with a 5% gain for the Internet overall (Facebook is a likely culprit), and warns its search profits could see further declines. YHOO -1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM

  • Market preview: S&P futures -0.4% in light trading, pressured by the euro falling below the...

    Market preview: S&P futures -0.4% in light trading, pressured by the euro falling below the key $1.30 level and Italian bond yields hitting new highs in an auction. Solar stocks head for a dark day after First Solar's massive guidance cut. Broadcom +6.7% following positive guidance; Avon +9% after saying it's going to replace its chief Avon lady. Later: EIA petroleum inventories.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • GRPN

    Believe it or not, some of Groupon's (NASDAQ:GRPN) IPO underwriters have launched coverage on...

    Believe it or not, some of Groupon's (NASDAQ:GRPN) IPO underwriters have launched coverage on the daily deals kingpin with neutral ratings. Included within this group is Deutsche, which is concerned about the profitability of Groupon's future growth, and Citi, which thinks Groupon's current valuation can only be justified if unproven new products pan out. GRPN -2.1%. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • SCHW

    November was tough on discount brokers, after volume had been increasing for much of the year on...

    November was tough on discount brokers, after volume had been increasing for much of the year on surging market volatility. Charles Schwab (NYSE:SCHW) lowers Q4 EPS expectations after average daily trading volume plunged 15% in November, and E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) says its average trading volume dropped 10%. SCHW -1.6%, ETFC -2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • FCX

    Freeport-McMoran Copper & Gold (NYSE:FCX) updates its Q4 forecast following the settlement...

    Freeport-McMoran Copper & Gold (NYSE:FCX) updates its Q4 forecast following the settlement of a strike with workers in Indonesia. The firm lowers its estimate for consolidated sales in Q4 to 800M pounds of copper and 105K ounces of gold, from previous guidance of 915M and 305K ounces, respectively. Shares -0.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • NBGGY

    Premarket gainers: NBG +10%. AVP +8%. BRCM +7%. CPST +5%. MTL +3%.Losers: FSLR -12%. LNG -7%....

    Premarket gainers: NBG +10%. AVP +8%. BRCM +7%. CPST +5%. MTL +3%.
    Losers: FSLR -12%. LNG -7%. TSL -6%. GMCR -5%. GRFS -3%. ECYT -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • FSLR

    It's shaping up to be an ugly day for solar stocks, as the massive guidance cut delivered by top...

    It's shaping up to be an ugly day for solar stocks, as the massive guidance cut delivered by top module vendor First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) raises new fears about the ability of industry players to survive the current downturn without wiping out equity holders - especially since First Solar, with its relatively high margins, has been seen as one of the stronger names. YGE -4.9%. TSL -5.3%. STP -2.5%. SPWR -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • SQNS

    Sequans Communications (NYSE:SQNS) -30% premarket after lowering Q4 guidance well below...

    Sequans Communications (NYSE:SQNS) -30% premarket after lowering Q4 guidance well below consensus, as a result of its largest customer's request to take delivery of ~40% of the chips previously scheduled for delivery in December and to cancel the remainder of the scheduled shipment.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • AVGO

    In stark contrast to the warnings delivered by peers, Broadcom (BRCM) is guiding for its Q4...

    In stark contrast to the warnings delivered by peers, Broadcom (BRCM) is guiding for its Q4 revenue to be at the high end of a prior guidance range of $1.7B-$1.8B, ahead of today's Analyst Day. Broadcom is also slightly lifting its gross margin guidance. Analysts will likely press Broadcom on whether its strength was broad-based, or (as is the case with other chipmakers) centered around wireless chips. BRCM +6.4%.
